Ten Lepers Cleansed
While*p He was on the way to Jerusalem, He was passing between Samaria and Galilee.
As He entered a village, ten leprous men who stood at a distance met Him;
and they raised their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
When He saw them, He said to them, “Go*r and*r show*r yourselves*r to*r the*r priests.”*r And as they were going, they were cleansed.
Now one of them, when he saw that he had been healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice,
and he fell on his face at His feet, giving thanks to Him. And he was a Samaritan.
Then Jesus answered and said, “Were*r there*r not*r ten*r cleansed?*r But*r the*r nine—where*r are*r they?*r
Was*r no*r one*r found*r who*r returned*r to*r give*r glory*r to*r God,*r except*r this*r foreigner?”*r
And He said to him, “Stand*r up*r and*r go;*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well.”*r
Now*p having been questioned by the Pharisees as to when the kingdom of God was coming, He answered them and said, “The*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r not*r coming*r with*r signs*r to*r be*r observed;*r
nor*r will*r they*r say,*r ‘Look,*r here*r it*ir is!’*ir or,*r ‘There*r it*ir is!’*ir For*r behold,*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r in*r your*r midst.”*r

Remember*r Lot’s*r wife.*r
